entity.name: Apollo Client
entity.description: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.
entity.descriptionClean: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.

example.codeHighlighted: const client = new ApolloClient({ uri, cache }) const query = gql` query Example { // ... } ` function Component() { const { loading, error, data } = useQuery(query) // ... }

entity.name: Axios
entity.description: Promise based HTTP client based on XMLHttpRequests.
entity.descriptionClean: Promise based HTTP client based on XMLHttpRequests.

example.codeHighlighted: const response = await axios.get(url)

entity.name: Relay
entity.description: The GraphQL client that scales with you. A framework for building data-driven React applications.
entity.descriptionClean: The GraphQL client that scales with you. A framework for building data-driven React applications.

example.codeHighlighted: const query = graphql` query Example { // ... } ` function Component() { const data = useLazyLoadQuery(query) // ... }

entity.name: RTK Query
entity.description: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching & caching logic yourself.
entity.descriptionClean: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching  caching logic yourself.
entity.descriptionHtml: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching & caching logic yourself.

example.codeHighlighted: const exampleApi = createApi({ baseQuery: fetchBaseQuery({ baseUrl }), endpoints: (builder) => ({ exampleQuery: builder.query({ query: () => `examplePath` }) }), // ... }) const store = configureStore({ reducer: { [exampleApi.reducerPath]: exampleApi.reducer }, // ... }) function Component() { const { data, error, isLoading } = exampleApi.useExampleQuery() // ... }

entity.name: SWR
entity.description: React Hooks for Data Fetching. A strategy to first return the data from cache (stale), then send the fetch request (revalidate), and finally come with the up-to-date data.
entity.descriptionClean: React Hooks for Data Fetching. A strategy to first return the data from cache (stale), then send the fetch request (revalidate), and finally come with the up-to-date data.

example.codeHighlighted: function Component() { const { data, error, isLoading } = useSWR(url, fetcher) // ... }

entity.name: TanStack Query
entity.description: (former React Query) A data-fetching library that makes fetching, caching, synchronizing and updating server state in the application a breeze.
entity.descriptionClean: (former React Query) A data-fetching library that makes fetching, caching, synchronizing and updating server state in the application a breeze.

example.codeHighlighted: const queryClient = new QueryClient() function Component() { const { isPending, error, data } = useQuery({ queryKey: ['example'], queryFn }) // ... }

entity.name: tRPC
entity.description: A solution that allows you to easily build & consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.
entity.descriptionClean: A solution that allows you to easily build  consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.
entity.descriptionHtml: A solution that allows you to easily build & consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.

example.codeHighlighted: const trpc = createTRPCClient<AppRouter>() function Component() { const result = trpc.hello.useQuery() // ... }
